assessments.status_rationale: Multiple outlets report the Fed held rates steady at its January 2026 meeting (e.g., NYT: "Fed Holds Rates Steady" on 2026-01-28; CNBC takeaways on the decision). This matches the prediction that the federal funds target range would be left unchanged by the 2026-01-29 announcement deadline.
Today’s bullets contain no market-close data for DXY and no statement that DXY closed below 95.00 on any day. The deadline is 2026-03-31, so the claim remains open.
No Redfin reporting or cited cancellation-rate figures appear in today’s news bullets. The deadline is 2026-04-30, so there is insufficient evidence to resolve the forecast.

While one CNBC item references avoiding a shutdown, none of the bullets confirm a DHS-only continuing resolution or appropriations law being signed into law. With the deadline of 2026-02-07, this remains unresolved.

Today’s coverage includes ICE-related protests and an attack on Rep. Ilhan Omar, but does not report articles of impeachment being introduced against DHS Secretary Kristi Noem. Deadline is 2026-03-31.
No bullet mentions Vineyard Wind or a public confirmation of resuming offshore turbine installation/construction. Deadline is 2026-06-30.
No bullet indicates Anthropic announced a new equity round totaling at least $3.0B. Deadline is 2026-06-30.
None of the items mention OpenSSL CVE-2025-15467 or distribution advisories from Ubuntu/Debian/Red Hat/SUSE/Amazon Linux. Deadline is 2026-02-29.
There is no Humana earnings/guidance update cited in today’s bullets, and no evidence of a ≥2% downward revision to 2026 revenue guidance. Deadline is 2026-05-15.
